main event: A bright, glowing object was observed in the sky near the Smithsonian satellite-observing station in Curacao, British West Indies on October 27, 1958.
interesting points: The object was observed by the station crew and described as a 'brilliantly glowing object' that was moving erratically and fluctuating in brightness.
The observers initially thought the object must be less distant than it seemed and went out by car to get a closer look, but the mystery was solved when they approached the area.
A plantation manager and his servant also observed the object from a field, and it was determined that the 'glowing object' was actually a lighted pressure lantern.

On October 8, 1961, Walter S. Dornfeld and John D. Drazba investigated a UFO report in Canton, Ohio. The object was described as being about 50 feet in diameter and 15-20 feet thick, with flashing lights around its perimeter and a bright light on the underside.
The object made no noise and was observed for approximately 15 minutes before suddenly accelerating and disappearing from view.
sighted object: a brilliantly glowing object moving erratically and fluctuating in brightness
witnesses: Smithsonian satellite-observing station crew, plantation manager and servant
